intro: Litsea andreana, commonly known as the Philippine lauraceae, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the Philippines and is typically found in lowland and montane forests. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Litsea andreana plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, supporting local wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
